name: AI Foundations
description: This KU describes basic concepts of artificial intelligence (AI). It includes basic security principles surrounding AI and applications of AI, along with privacy and ethical considerations in training and using AI.
outcomes: Define the principles and concepts of Artificial Intelligence.
Identify the history and key components of AI.
Describe applications of AI techniques in intelligent agents, expert systems, artificial neural networks, and generative models.
Discuss ethical considerations, including bias/fairness, privacy, and security issues related to AI development and implementation.
Implement basic AI algorithms to solve practical problems.
Use AI techniques in designing intelligent systems that learn from experience.
Differentiate between various types of AI tools and techniques, such as Generative AI, Explainable AI (XAI), and Machine Learning Principles.
Analyze the role of AI and its significance for cybersecurity.
Assess the applications and limitations of AI in cybersecurity and workplace settings.
Evaluate the ethical implications of AI applications, focusing on bias, fairness, privacy, and security.
Design and develop intelligent systems incorporating AI solutions to computational problems.
Formulate perspectives on the future possibilities of modern AI methods.
topics: Differences between AI and Machine Learning (ML)
Types of AI and AI Tools
notes: Special instructions or explanations: Focus on practical applications and real-world examples., Integrate hands-on activities such as building and experimenting with simple AI models., Emphasize ethical considerations and security implications of AI.
